entry.title: SAP Cloud ALM(Health Monitoring):Dialog Steps
entry.content:
Dear SAP,

 

Please see the attached document for details.

 

„ÄêQ1„Äë

 

Which SAP Cloud ALM Task Type corresponds to which SAP GUI for Windows Task Type Name?

 

Dialog‚Üí???

 

Batch‚Üí???

 

RFC‚ÜíRFC?

 

HTTPS‚ÜíHTTP?

 

„ÄêQ2„Äë

 

I checked ST03N for managed system at about the same time on the same day.The output results are attached as a "Data" sheet.

 

Which column in this table is the value of SAP Cloud ALM calculated based on?

 

Regards,


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: SAP Cloud ALM(Health Monitoring):Dialog Steps
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

 

Thanks for your patience.

 

As per internal investigation, the metric "Dialog Steps" in Health Monitoring displays the average number of dialog steps per minute while ST03 show the total of dialog steps.

So the metric for "Dialog Steps" in Health Monitoring of SAP Cloud ALM and ST03 in the ABAP managed system cannot be compared.

Currently it is not possible to obtain absolute values for dialog steps in SAP Cloud ALM. 

This is also recorded under KBA 3534135.

Please kindly feel free to let me know when further inquiries.

 

Best Regards,

Sunny

entry.title: Enabaling/Disabling SAP Macros Table Action buttons with JS?
entry.content:
Hi all -wanted to know if its possible to control enabling/disabling a SAP Macros Table action on the front-end? I have a SAP UI5 application based on the Flexible Programming Model template. I have a task where when a user selects a table row, the action button should only enable when a specific table field is set to a certain value. 

Ex. When table field = 1 -> action1 button should be enabled. If table field is not 1, then action1 button is disabled. I know that the SAP macros XML attribute "enabled" can be set to false and true and I was hoping I can control that manually. 

I started the logic by grabbing the table controller "this.byId("table name") and can see the actions inside the object. I just was not sure if there were methods to retrieve the action objects? 

 

<macros:Table class="table" id="Table" metaPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.LineItem" filterBar="FilterBar" selectionMode="Single">
            <macros:actions>
              <macroTable:Action id="action1" key="closeEodAction" text="Test" press=".onTest"
                                 placement="After" requiresSelection="true" />
            </macros:actions>

entry.title: Check for duplicate credit memo in SAP S4 HANA 2023
entry.content:
The SAP note 305277 mentions :

"As of SAP S/4HANA 2023 (On Premise), the new indicator "Check Credit Memo" has been introduced for Customizing (no need for a modification anymore).
If you set the "Check Credit Memo" indicator, you can configure the system to check for duplicate invoices when you enter a credit memo"

What exactly is the configuration that is required to be done here ? And what is the SPRO path for the customizing ? It would be great if someone could help me on this.

entry.title: Re: Automatic update of custom MDF object data
entry.content:
Hi @Aneta_Krysiak 

Your requirement will work in integration centre, you can create a job in integration centre   to schedule a job to move the updated content from one MDF to another MDF based on the latest update in the source MDF. 

Creation of IC job with below selection,

Trigger Type: Scheduled

Source type : SuccessFactors (MDF 1)

Destination Type:- SuccessFactors (MDF 2)

Format: OData v2

B/w source and destination MDFs, associate the fields for replication.

Please refer the below screenshots for reference,

12345678

Thanks & Regards

Arun

entry.title: Highlights and key take aways of Day 1 of SAP ALM SUMMIT APAC 2025
entry.content:
Hi ALM Folks,

Here is the highlight of Day 1 of SAP ALM Summit APAC 2025.


üöÄ Reflections from SAP ALM Summit APAC 2025 ‚Äì A Truly Global Milestone! üåè

Just wrapped up Day 1 of the biggest SAP ALM Summit ever ‚Äì with 800+ registrations and counting! Here are some of my key takeaways:

üîπ Sonal Kumar‚Äôs Keynote
‚úÖ Over 10,000+ customers now on SAP Cloud ALM, with 500+ being added every week!
‚úÖ This year‚Äôs focus: AI-first and how it‚Äôs transforming lifecycle management.
‚úÖ SAP Cloud ALM continues to evolve as an intelligent, autonomous platform.

üîπ Sindhu Gangadharan‚Äôs Perspective :
üí° Modern businesses face diverse challenges across roles and verticals.
üí° The answer? A smart, integrated solution combining Applications, Data, and AI.
üí° Joule is at the heart of this synergy, powering intelligent insights across SAP.

üîπ Soeren Ruder‚Äôs Vision :
‚ú® Emphasized on ‚ÄúAI First and Suite First‚Äù
üîÅ Shared SAP Cloud ALM‚Äôs journey towards becoming Autonomous Cloud ALM
üõ†Ô∏è Demonstrated the simple roadmap to plan your Cloud ALM Transition

üîπ Live Demo by Resmi K S :
üë©‚Äçüíª A powerful use case of Integration & Exception Monitoring
ü§ñ Joule‚Äôs role in root cause analysis and real-time resolution ‚Äì truly game-changing!

üîπ Insights from Andreas (Tricentis)
üìä Testing accounts for 30%+ effort in 90%+ of SAP projects ‚Äì
‚úÖ Hence, the need for an integrated toolchain with Tricentis + SAP Cloud ALM!

üìå Additional Nuggets from Day 1 for future scopes:
‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Integrity Checks in SAP CLOUD ALM before Go-Live
‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ In SAP CLOUD ALM for Operations ‚Üí Business continuity, open for SAP & non-SAP, analytics in Grafana, autonomous ALM
‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Memory Estimation for ABAP systems
‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Mass Config & Health Monitoring enhancements
‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Advanced Role & Access Management
‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Auto Connections & security analysis reimagined
‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Best practices for keeping 8GB in check
‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Availability Monitoring of ABAP Based System, connection monitoring, DB backup strategies

The message was clear: The path to success lies in an integrated, AI-powered toolchain ‚Äî and SAP Cloud ALM is leading that path. üåü

üëè Hats off to the organizers, speakers, and demo teams for such an inspiring start!

#SAPCloudALM #SAPALMSummit2025 #SAP #Tricentis #AIinALM #Joule #DigitalTransformation #IntegratedToolchain #ApplicationLifecycleManagement #AutonomousALM #SAPCommunity

#SAP #CloudALM #FocusedRun #ALM #ALMSummitAPAC2025

entry.title: SAP Discovery Center Mission: Build custom Joule skills for SAP & non-SAP systems using Joule Studio
entry.content:
SAP is on a mission to make Joule, its generative AI assistant, ubiquitous across the entire product portfolio - from S/4HANA and SuccessFactors to BTP and SAP Build. SAP ships Joule with a rich set of out-of-the-box skills to fetch data, transact, navigate, automate tasks, and deliver contextual insights through natural language. But many organizations need more: tailored responses, industry-specific workflows, and integration with custom systems etc.,

That‚Äôs where Joule Studio comes in. With Joule Studio, businesses can build custom Joule skills and agents for both SAP and non-SAP systems, empowering users with AI-driven capabilities tailored to their unique processes.

Note: Joule Studio is part of SAP Build. With SAP Build, you can now create low-code/no-code apps, processes, approvals, automations, and decisions. It also supports pro-code development using Fiori, CAP, and mobile frameworks. You can design compelling user experience sites; all natively infused with Generative AI to enhance productivity and accelerate time-to-value.

What is Joule Studio?

Joule Studio is a developer-friendly environment that enables both professional developers and business technologists to create, manage, and deploy AI-powered skills and agents. Whether it‚Äôs fetching data from S/4HANA or triggering a multi-step process in ServiceNow, Joule Studio simplifies it - with little to no code.

This blog focuses on the SAP Discovery Center mission dedicated to building Joule skills using Joule Studio. (Agent development is currently in beta, with general availability planned for Q4 2025. Stay tuned for a follow-up blog on that).

Why Joule Studio?

Joule Studio enables you to:

  • Build AI skills - atomic tasks triggered by natural language (e.g., ‚ÄúShow open purchase orders‚Äù).
  • Develop AI agents - multi-turn, intelligent assistants that manage complex workflows (e.g., onboarding an employee or exception handling in order processing, finding weather trends or tariff changes and suggesting pricing changes).

Key Features of Joule Studio:

Feature

Description

Visual Skill Builder

No-code/low-code UI to define intents, logic, and response formats

Agent Framework

Design multi-step, multi-intent workflows with skills, memory, and branching logic

SAP Integration

Connect to BTP services, OData APIs, CDS views, workflows, and SAP applications.

Non-SAP Integration

Connect with external APIs like ServiceNow, MS Teams, and Salesforce

Human-in-the-loop

Include approval steps or manual interventions within agent workflows.

Security & Identity

Uses SAP BTP‚Äôs security model for authentication, role management, and access control.

Multichannel Deployment

Deploy skills and agents across SAP Start, SAP Build Work Zone, MS Teams, and more

Deep Dive: Joule skills:

Joule skills are components of an advanced AI model designed to execute atomic operations - single, predefined tasks that run independently and deterministically within a conversation. Joule Skills provide a fast, structured, and reliable way to automate repetitive business tasks and retrieve data within SAP systems. They eliminate manual work, reduce errors, and improve efficiency, allowing users to focus on more strategic activities.

Key Capabilities of Joule skills:

  • Deterministic Execution ‚Äì Skills perform predefined actions with fixed inputs and outputs.
  • Natural Language Understanding ‚Äì Joule accurately interprets user intent regardless of phrasing.
  • Context Awareness ‚Äì Skills only trigger when contextually relevant, based on user role and interaction history.
  • Unified Automation ‚Äì SAP-provided and custom skills coexist in a single productive Joule instance.

Key Characteristics of Jouke skills:

  • Intent-driven ‚Äì Each skill is initiated by natural language input.
  • Composable ‚Äì Skills can be combined to create intelligent workflows.
  • Low-code ‚Äì Built using tools like:
    • Condition Editor ‚Äì define logic based on data
    • Formula Editor ‚Äì manipulate and compute values
    • Skill Parameters ‚Äì manage input/output variables
    • Message Format Editor ‚Äì structure output for display
  • Extensible ‚Äì Easily customized for unique business processes
  • Action Projects ‚Äì Enable connectivity to remote systems (e.g., S/4HANA, Ariba, or Northwind) via APIs

Ready to Get Hands-On?

Joule Studio is shaping up to be one of the most significant releases in SAP Build in 2025. We know many of you are eager to dive in, experiment, and build your own AI skills.

To help you get started, our team has created and published a SAP Discovery Center Mission: Build custom Joule skills for SAP and non-SAP systems using Joule Studio.

This guided mission walks you through every step - validating prerequisites, setting up your environment, enabling necessary services, configuring connectivity to systems like S/4HANA, and building and testing your custom skills in Joule.

 

You'll walk away with a working Joule skills project featuring multiple skills - a solid foundation for building enterprise-ready, intelligent AI assistants.

So, what are you waiting for? 

üöÄGo to Build custom Joule skills for SAP and non-SAP systems using Joule Studio in SAP Discovery Center and start your mission. We‚Äôll be cheering for you.

Happy ‚ÄòBuild‚Äôing! üòä

Kudos to my co-authors @sdavid & @CharleneZ. Thanks to Joule Studio product management & engg team for early access.

entry.title: Re: Change stock with regards to UoM
entry.content:
Go to MM02 > Additional Data > UoM tab where update the conversion 1pc = 2kg. Save the changes. SAP allows changing the conversion factor only if no stock exists in the current or previous year. In your case, since there is a stock of 100 pc, you need to adjust the stock first

Post a Goods Issue for 50pc to reduce the stock with movement type 201, preferably to a dummy cost center. Post Goods Receipt back for 50pc with corrected UoM with movement type 202. This simulates a stock correction and allows you to re-enter the stock with the correct UoM relationship.

If you are using batch-managed or serialized materials, make sure to update the batch master data and classification to reflect the new weight per pc

entry.title: Re: EnableNow hands on guide template default is missing...
entry.content:
Hi,

Yes, I can see the issue from your images, you are missing the Word template from your documentation settings.  To fix the issue:

1. Open Producer
2. Start editing the Hands-On Guide object that is located in the Resources > Documentation Settings object.  This assumes that you want to update that set of settings

 

 

 

 

 

3. After obtaining editing control of the correct settings, ensure that the Template field is open for editing, i.e. it has a green square in front of it, and click the pencil button on the end of the field

4. In the Template dialog box, locate the Resources object.  If the Resources object is not visible in the dialog box, click the filter button to the right of the Search field and select Show Resources

 

5. Once the Resources object is visible, open the Resources > Adaptable Resources > Documentation Styles section to display the Word and PPT templates that can be used to generate documentation
6. Click on the relevant Word template and click OK
7. The Template field should now show the name of the template to be used when generating that type of documentation.

 

 

 

Your documentation should now generate correctly.

Regards
Shane

entry.title: Re: To update REGUH-VALUDT based on individual invoice it...

entry.title: Re: SAP ARM- Control Sub Doc FOC Creation
entry.content:
Based on your post and whatever Returns parameter controls you listed, SAP assumes customer is returning the product and the replacement is approved to be sent immediately. This causes the system to create both the returns delivery and the SDF document automatically, bypassing the warehouse inspection step.

To ensure the SDF is created only after warehouse inspection, you need to adjust the Refund Control setting:

Change Refund Control from P (Approved) to A (After Receipt of Credit Memo) or R (By Credit Memo Request). These options defer the creation of the SDF until after inspection and refund approval. The warehouse inspection (via transaction MSR_INSPWH) becomes the trigger point for releasing the SDF. This allows your quality team to inspect the returned goods and decide whether the replacement should be sent.

entry.title: Re: Applying Credit Memo for RMA to original Sales Order
entry.content:
The credit memo (6-series document) reverses revenue at the FI level, but it doesn‚Äôt retroactively adjust the original sales order‚Äôs revenue recognition status. The sales order document flow shows the credit memo reference, but the billing status remains ‚Äúfully billed.‚Äù SAP‚Äôs Revenue Recognition (RAR) or SD-FI integration may still treat the original SO as fully realized unless explicitly configured otherwise.

What you can try is if you're using SAP Revenue Accounting and Reporting (RAR) Configure contract modification logic to treat RMAs as negative performance obligations. This allows the system to defer or reverse revenue based on the credit memo and link it to the original SO.

The other option is ensure that the credit memo is posted with reference to the original SO so that CO-PA (Profitability Analysis) can reverse the revenue at the same segment level. Use KE4S or KE4SFI to reconcile FI and CO-PA postings.

entry.title: Re: Condition Contract Settlement: No Split by Company Co...
entry.content:
As of S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, there is no standard functionality that allows automatic splitting of settlement documents by Company Code from a single condition contract. Even when using Business Place (BUPLA) or other split criteria in the business volume split profile, the system still generates a single settlement document based on the aggregated business volume

Try with the below workaround

Use Separate Condition Contracts per Company Code. This ensures that each legal entity has its own settlement document and accounting entries. You can still use the same supplier and rebate logic, but scoped to each company.

If you must use a single contract, consider allocating the rebate amount manually post-settlement using journal entries or intercompany postings. This is less elegant but may be acceptable for low-volume or infrequent settlements.

Since you mentioned not having the 5XU license (which includes extended localization features), here are your options:

If this is a recurring issue, consider submitting a request to SAP to extend VATDATE editability to France and Germany.

  1. Ensure users are trained to validate VATDATE before posting.
  2. Consider adding custom validations or warnings via the Custom Logic app to flag suspicious VATDATE entries.
  3. Keep an eye on notes like SAP Note 1232484, which outlines VATDATE behavior and country-specific enhancements.

entry.title: Getting Started with Joule Studio in SAP Build - Part 3: Integrate Joule Skills with Work Zone Sites
entry.content:
Disclaimer: The insights shared in this blog are based on my personal observations and learning. They may not apply universally, and I encourage readers to conduct their own research and make an informed decision before using this content for productive use.

In Last Part of this series, we covered how to create a skill, consume public APIs and deploying it for consumption.

In this guide, we will walk through the process of creating a custom skill related to a specific application (a CAP based Fiori application in this case), deploying it, and finally enabling Joule in SAP Build Work Zone.

Develop and Deploy Joule Skills for a Custom Application.

Step-by-Step Process:

  • Create a Destination in SAP BTP Subaccount where Joule Studio is subscribed ‚Äì pointing to the endpoint of your CAP service
  • Make sure sap.processautomation.enabled is set to true in additional properties for it to be consumed in SAP Build

 

 

  • Add Destination into the Control Tower section

 

  • Select Action section and Click Create to start a new action project.

 

  • Select SAP Cloud Application Programming Model as your action will have to point to a SAP Cloud Application Programming Model Service.

 

  • This lists down all possible service calls available

 

  • Select required endpoint and configure it.

 

 

  • Click Create, then select the Joule Skill tile and follow steps as per the previous blog in series - Getting Started with Joule Studio in SAP Build - P... - SAP Community

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  • Save, release, and deploy the skill to your environment.

 

  • If you want your skills to be accessible globally from the work zone site, enable the shared environment property. Else, these skills will be available only on a standalone assistant.

 

 

Integrate Joule with Work zone

  • Under Formations in Global Account level, Click Include systems and select SAP Build Work Zone from required Subaccount

 

  • Select both Enable Capability Deployment and Enable Joule Icon in Integrated System

 

  • Complete the wizard by clicking Include

 

  • Once complete, navigate to System Landscape ‚Üí Formation.

 

 

  • Login to your work zone

 

  • Select Required Site and click on Settings icon

 

  • You should now be seeing property to Enable/Disable Joule. Enable the Joule property.

 

 

  • Open your site and you should be seeing the Joule Icon at the top

 

  • Test your deployed skills by prompting your query

 

 

 

 

Conclusion:

By integrating Joule Skills with SAP Build Work Zone, you bring intelligent assistance directly into your business applications. This part of the series demonstrated how to connect a CAP-based Fiori application, configure destinations, and deploy skills for real-time use within Work Zone.

With these steps, you empower users to interact with enterprise data and processes seamlessly using natural language‚Äîmaking your applications not just smarter, but more user-centric.

entry.title: Re: Automatic Vendor invoice in intercompany STO process-...
entry.content:
Why Your Current Setup Works for Sales but not STO is because, for Intercompany sales, system uses Output type RD04, IDoc INVOIC01 and Partner profiles and logical addresses to automatically post the AP journal entry in the receiving company. However, for intercompany STOs, especially with invoice type CBST, the system doesn‚Äôt trigger the same EDI logic by default. This is because the internal customer/vendor mapping is different and the billing document (CBST) isn‚Äôt automatically linked to the EDI output framework unless explicitly configured

SAP‚Äôs Recommended Approach for STO EDI Posting is Create a vendor in the receiving company representing the supplying company. Create a customer in the supplying company representing the receiving company. Assign these in the intercompany configuration (SSCUI 105970)
Use Output Parameter Determination to assign output type (e.g., RD04 or custom) to CBST. Ensure the output triggers IDoc INVOIC01 with correct partner profile

Use the following SSCUIs to complete the setup:

entry.title: JavaScript works in Adobe Form Designer for Check Printing but not in BTP Runtime
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I‚Äôm working on a Check Printing Form using Adobe Interactive Forms (developed via Adobe LiveCycle Designer). In the form, I‚Äôve written a JavaScript function to convert the numeric check amount into words, like:

123456.78 ‚Üí "Rupees One Lakh Twenty Three Thousand Four Hundred Fifty Six and Seventy Eight Paise Only"

The script is placed under the calculate event of a text field. This works perfectly in local Adobe Designer preview, but after uploading to SAP BTP Forms Runtime, the amount in words is not displaying at all.

 

My JavaScript Code (Client-Side)

 

1. After uploading to SAP BTP (Forms by Adobe), the script does not run
2.The amount in words is blank on the output PDF generated in cloud

 My Questions:

  1. Is client-side JavaScript supported in SAP BTP Check Printing Adobe Forms?

  2. Is there any alternative way to achieve Amount in Words in BTP (e.g., ABAP backend or script object)?

  3. How should I implement this logic so that it works after upload to BTP?

Any guidance or workaround for handling amount in words in check printing would be appreciated. 

Thanks in advance,

Archana

entry.title: Re: No EP user in Integration Center Job Output
entry.content:
Hi @RishabhGupta19881 

This is an expected behaviour as you are using EmpEmployment entity as a starting entity, and then fetching all the records the Contractors information will not be included as there is no record of EmpEmployment for these employees.

Hence if you want to fetch these Contractors User details, you will have to use the Starting entity as User and then fetch all the active employee details.

If you want to fetch Inactive employees as well then you will have to include the below filter criteria as per the KBA mentioned below
filter=status in 't','f'

2736579 - How to Query Different Types of Users via "USER" entity in SuccessFactors OData

Hope this helps resolve your issue.

Regards
Abhijith Menon

entry.title: Re: OTP based login in SAC dashboard
entry.content:
Hi Team,

One-Time Password (OTP)-based login is not natively supported by SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) by default. However, by combining SAC with an identity provider (IdP) that supports OTP (such Azure AD, Okta, or SAP IAS with MFA enabled), you can provide OTP-based login.

regards,

G

entry.title: Re: Usage Records (GET on /usage-records)
entry.content:
Hello Danashree,
The itemId and chargeId are unique identifiers for the bill item and the charge within the bill model. 
These properties can only be retrieved from GET on /bills/{identifier} if expand parameter usageRecords is applied and the number of returned usage records is more than 100.

Please check information provide within the API Guide here Retrieve Usage Records for a Charge

Kind regards 
Ralf

entry.title: Re: Can we copy unreleased CDS view code and use it for d...
entry.content:
Hi ,

Yes, you can make your own custom views by copying the unpublished CDS view code, but do not rely on it as a stable dependence.

  • Unreleased views are not stable.

    • SAP may change or delete them without notice in upgrades.

    • You risk breaking your custom view if you depend too tightly on them.

  • SAP does not support reuse of unreleased views.

    • If you raise an OSS incident, SAP will not support issues related to unreleased CDS usage.

  • Performance and Authorization Issues:

    • Unreleased CDS views may not be optimized or may lack correct annotations like @AccessControl.authorizationCheck.

Hope it helps!

Thanks with regards,

Raaj

entry.title: Message dteermination for PO: Exclusive indicator not working
entry.content:
Dear gurus,

 

I fear that for years I might have had a big misconception about messages for POs and in general and I would appreciate if you could clarify.

 

In our system it was our idea to create two message types for POs: ZMAI for E-Mail and ZPRI for print output. Thus, we thought it would be easier for our users if they ever had to manually create a message.

 

We set up our message determination schema like this:

10           1             ZPRI       PO print               101

11           1             ZMAI     PO e-mail            101

 

Furthermore, we created one condition record for ZMAI for document type NB. For the few suppliers who want to recieve the POs printed on paper, we created an additional condition type for ZPRI for Doc.Type/Purch.Org/Vendor.

 

We expected SAP to automatically create a ZPRI message if there was a vendor-specific condition record (Doc.Type/Purch.Org/Vendor) for ZPRI and a ZMAI message if not.

 

Instead, if there is a vendor-specific ZPRI condition record, BOTH messages are created.

 

I did not understand this, because the access sequence is set up like this:

5             027         Purchasing Output Determination: Purch. Org./Vendor for EDI                  exclusive

11           025         Purchasing Output Determination: Doc.Type/Purch.Org/Vendor              exclusive

20           026         Purchasing Output Determination: Document Type                                        exclusive

 

Because auf the exclusive indicator I expected SAP to stop looking for the second condition record (document type NB). But it does not, it finds both records.

 

Now I fear that that is because we created two seperate message types and the access sequence is valid for both of them independently. Thus, first the ZPRI record is found and then SAP finds the ZMAI record.

 

Could anyone please check and confirm? Thank you!

 

Furthermore I would like to know if the only way to achieve the desired behaviour is to create just ONE message type with two processing routines, one for print output and one for external send.

 

Cheers
Jens

entry.title: Re: SMTP Inbound - 554 Transaction failed
entry.content:
Hi SAP community, 

I also faced the issue of error "SMTP Inboud - 544 Transaction failed" and was almost desparate when, after working on the solutions SAP and OP described, still nothing worked. 

Finally, after 4h try and error, I recognized, that the SICF service SAPconnect became inactive, after following the steps described in note 2417443.

Once I activated the SICF service SAPconnect, the error disappeared.

Best regards,
Daniel

entry.title: Re: Adaptation projects in Business Application Studio br...
entry.content:
I was having similar issues after the updates that you have mentioned. ( I wasn't able to preview the app at all and adaptation editor wasn't starting). What I did is to change the the ui5 version in ui5.yaml file which helped out with that issue and everything started working again.

Afterwards however I got a new issue, each time when I made some changes to the app, the changes didn't show up in the local version and was impossible to debug (the only way was to deploy to production system and debug and test there). Today I managed to find a solution for that as well. What I did was:

- delete the node_moddules folder from the app
- ran the "npm install" command. (but got a lot of vulnerabilities, some were critical)
- ran "npm audit fix" which fixed most of the vulnerabilities, but not all (the critical ones were resolved)

Now the last changes that I make to the app, show up in the local version and I'm able to debug again.
Hope this helps!

entry.title: Re: I have a requirement for add multiple default value i...
entry.content:
Hi,

Given that a CDS annotation cannot hardcode more than one default value, SAP advises allowing the end user or app developer to:

Use a selection variant if you're using an analytical app or Fiori Elements.

The Fiori app allows you to save filters with multiple values.

Make sure to include filter values in the default layout when utilizing analytical queries.

Hope it helps,

Regards,

Raaj

entry.title: Can S-price materials not be posted to UMB when running MR22?
entry.content:
Dear experts

When S-price materials execute MR22, when the material value is increased, the debit account is PRD and the credit account is UMB
